update.description:
Chunk metadata is now updated for telomeric regions where the chunk start/end boundaries do not start until data is first/last defined for a chromosome respectively.

Chunk metadata now takes into account gaps between supercontigs where there is no data present greater than `MIN_GAP_LEN`.

Empty supercontigs that form gaps greater than `MIN_GAP_LEN` of missing data before and after itself are considered empty and have empty chunk metadata.

Closes Issue #43
update.title: Better chunk metadata for gaps in telomeric regions and between supercontigs

content.raw:
The `mask_present` is essentially a boolean "present" | "not present" numpy array. `argmax` gives the index of the maximum value. In the case of ties (which there will be) `argmax` returns the first index with the maximum value.
I believe this is the recommended (and fastest?) way of finding the first occurrence of a value in numpy as far as I know. I could not find a better way of doing this.

I did comment on this specific behavior on Line 182 but it was not mentioned here. I could replicate the comment here if necessary.
content.html:
The mask_present is essentially a boolean "present" | "not present" numpy array. argmax gives the index of the maximum value. In the case of ties (which there will be) argmax returns the first index with the maximum value. I believe this is the recommended (and fastest?) way of finding the first occurrence of a value in numpy as far as I know. I could not find a better way of doing this.

I did comment on this specific behavior on Line 182 but it was not mentioned here. I could replicate the comment here if necessary.

content.raw:
```
prev_supercontigs = [None] + supercontigs[:-1]
next_supercontigs = supercontigs[1:] + [None]

zipper = zip(prev_supercontigs, supercontigs, next_supercontigs)

for prev_supercontig, supercontig, next_supercontig in zipper:
```
content.html:
prev_supercontigs = [None] + supercontigs[:-1]
next_supercontigs = supercontigs[1:] + [None]

zipper = zip(prev_supercontigs, supercontigs, next_supercontigs)

for prev_supercontig, supercontig, next_supercontig in zipper:
